description:
Join us for Ann Arbor
Restaurant Week
January 15th – 20th, 2017
Lunch & Dinner

http://www.annarborrestaurantweek.com/

Reservations Recommended
(888) 456-3463 (DINE)
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week

description:
Ann Arbor Restaurant Week is your opportunity to try as many great Ann Arbor restaurants as your schedule allows for one incredibly low fixed price.

Vinology Wine Bar and Restaurant is proud to be part of this great event, offered from January 15 - 20.  Enjoy a three course dinner for only $28!
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week

description:
Join our Little Peeps crew for a celebration of all things winter. The morning will include a short interactive performance, drama activities, and a craft centered on winter fun.

Recommended for pre-k through grade 5.
Tickets: $7 for the first child, $5 for each additional child
Adults are free.
name: Little Peeps - Winter Wonderland

description:
We'd love for you to join us for Ann Arbor Restaurant Week, January 15th-20th. Click the link to view our lunch and dinner options for two. We have vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free options.

Also, $.50 from each Restaurant Week meal purchased at the brewpub will be donated to Food Gatherers!

http://www.annarborrestaurantweek.com/…/arborbrewingcompany/
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week at Arbor Brewing Company

description:
Restaurant Week is your opportunity to try as many great Ann Arbor restaurants as your schedule allows for one incredibly low fixed price. $15 for lunch and $28 for a three course dinner with many restaurants offering 2 for 1 pricing!

Check out www.annarborrestaurantweek.com for participating restaurants and menu offerings!
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week

description:
Children ages four to seven are invited to hear a story in the galleries. Stories will be followed by a short activity responding to the art on display. Parents must accompany children. Siblings are welcome to join the group. The story on January 21 will focus on Traces: Reconstructing the History of a Chokwe Mask. Meet in front of the UMMA Store.

Storytime is generously supported by the University of Michigan Credit Union Arts Adventures Program, UMMA's Lead Sponsor for Student and Family Engagement.
name: Storytime at the Museum

description:
Combining parlor games with the classic social lubricant (alcohol) to multiply their ice busting powers.

We will supply some low-key interactive games and craft beer. 
Bring your friends or make some new ones. 
Saturdays at 4pm.
Pointless Brewery & Theatre. 3014 Packard Road, Ann Arbor.
name: Icebreakers^2

description:
These shows are completely improvised, and star an impressive cast of experienced local improvisers, including our resident company The League of Pointless Improvisers. 

Group 1: Seven Minutes In Heaven   
Group 2: Bad Boys II
Group 3: The League of Pointless Improvisers
name: Pointless Improv with Seven Minutes In Heaven and Bad Boys II

description:
Sat. January 21 | 9pm | 18+ | $12 Cover

Ghost Rock is the new album from the Michigan-based collective NOMO. The album, produced by Warn Defever, sheds light on the way forward for a band that has been forging its own vital sound. This is not the Afrobeat of Fela, nor the revivalist funk of a forgotten decade. This record owes as much to Can, Eno, and MIA as it does Kuti, Francis Bebey, and Funkadelic. On Ghost Rock, NOMO arrives in a new place. There's no loss of steam as they incorporate new influences, instead NOMO breaks through with a matured and developed sound that is fully its own.

WSG: minihorse
name: NOMO 1/21/17 at the Blind Pig - Ann Arbor
